resources.string:
This app is one of the many Green Food Challenge apps created for CMPT 276 Fall 2018. This app aims to help residents of Metro Vancouver collectively reduce green house gas emissions by changing their diet.
 
 Many necessities for living nowadays produce greenhouse gases, a significant type of which are classified as Carbon Dioxide eqivalents (CO2e).
 
 Food is generally under-reported as a source of CO2e. For instance in Europe, agriculture contributes to 10% of the total carbon footprint. In particular, some animals produce methane and therefore more CO2e than other animals.
 
 In this app, people will learn how much their diet produces in terms of CO2e, and discover how much CO2e they could save by exploring new options. After they make their effort to make a difference, they can make a pledge to show their dedication and see who else is making pledges to collectively make an impact.
 
 This app will be developed in 3 phases:
 1. Green Food Challenge Carbon Calculator
 2. Green Food Challenge Group Pledge
 3. Green Food Challenge Restaurant Guide
 
 The Development Team:
 
 Jack Zhou - Scrum Master
 Weijie Sun - Product Owner
 Hewei Cao - Team Member
 Yijin Ma - Team Member
 Min-jun Lee - Repo Manager
